This is a great time for families to complete the Census, especially since many parents are home with their children. Families may respond online at www.my2020census.gov, by calling the toll-free number, 1-844-330-2020, or by mailing back the questionnaire they receive in the mail. The toll-free number is in 12 different languages.

Your response helps to direct billions of dollars in federal funds to local communities for schools, roads, and other public services.

Teachers are also encouraged to incorporate the Census in their weekly lesson plans. Resources can be found on the Statistics in Schools website, www.census.gov/programs-surveys/sis.html.

West Clay Elementary Principal, Brad Cox, and several of his teachers had the opportunity to video chat with the head of the literacy department in Massachusetts!

How did this happen? West Clay Elementary has been recognized as a school in Mississippi who has made great strides in reading growth with its students. Our state department of education has been impressed with how West Clay has been teaching reading, writing, and phonics to students, so they connected Mr. Cox with the head of the literacy department in Massachusetts. Massachusetts' literacy director wanted to "pick West Clay's brain" on the practices they are using with their students so they can incorporate the same practices in Massachusetts!

Way to go Mr. Cox, all staff at West Clay, our students, and their families. We know working hard always pays off. Congratulations!
